text: Ominous black clouds roll across the heavens.  THUNDER be to RUMBLE within the clouds.  An unsettling feeling of approaching danger.
Deep shadowed woods. A quiet breeze rustles some dry leav NOISY CRICKETS.  Some unseen creature runs through the bu THE CRICKETS STOP.
A very mangy wild dog feeds on what was once a rabbit run over in the road.  ROARING AROUND THE BEND COMES AN OLD F PICKUP. The terrified canine runs for its life into the w
We stare down on Jason's infamous mask held in a young ma (HAWES) hands.
(Southern accent) I don't know how the hell you talked me into this, Jarvis.
Sitting in the passenger seat examining the mask is ALLEN HAWES.  He is a rather unusual-looking guy in his mid- twenties, nervously smoking a cigar.
Hell, I must be crazy.  If the old institution ever found out about this...boy, they'd throw our butts back in an' strait-jacket 'em permanent.
TOMMY (o.s.) You didn't have to come, Hawes...
TOMMY JARVIS is a good-looking young man in his late teen He drives like a bat out of hell, wearing a very intense expression of determination.
This is between me and Jason.
(becoming more nervous) Yeah, I know.  But I still don't get the therapy here. Jason's dead, right?  How will seeing his corpse stop your hallucinations?
Seeing it won't. But destroying him once and for all will. Jason belongs in hell.
(coldly) I'm gonna see he gets there.
stares wide-eyed at Tommy.  He then turns to look out the back window.

head_text.subj: TIGHT ON HAWES' FACE IN REAR WINDOW

text: A huge can of gasoline, a crowbar and two shovels are see the back of the truck.  THUNDER BEGINS TO RUMBLE LOUDER.
Dust kicks up as the old pickup races down the road. LIGHTNING FLASHES, illuminating the dark woods.  THUNDER CRASHES HELLISHLY.
TRACKING along a row of tombstones, we follow Tommy and h flashlight as he searches.  Hawes follows, carrying the g can, tools and mask. THUNDER continues as a fierce, whist WIND attacks.
Tommy's eyes squint to read each tombstone, looking for t one.  LIGHTNING FLASHES.
Getting frustrated, but far from giving up, Tommy moves t the new row of markers.  Suddenly he freezes and we PRESS on him.
LIGHTNING illuminates the tombstone that reads "Jason Voorhees - At Rest".
As he stares, a deep terror chills his bones.  Something then catches his eye.
Close to Jason's marker we see another.  It reads "Pamela Voorhees - Beloved Mother."
Returning his attention to Jason's grave, Tommy points "t is the one" to Hawes, who gulps and nods.  Putting down t other items, the boys take hold of the shovels.  Tommy ra his up first.
plunges into the ground.  A LIGHTNING BLAST punctuates it it removes a large chunk of grass and dirt.
They begin to exhume the legendary killer's body. Tommy w feverishly.  Hawes works nervously.
Again and again their shovels strike, digging into the ea
is scraping the dirt of of a rotted coffin lid.
The sweating boy tosses the shovel out of the shallow gra Hawes silently hands him the crowbar from above.
The crowbar is driven into the side.  Tommy's hands take firm grip and yank.  A HORRIFIC CREAK resounds as the lid cracks open.
He hands the crowbar back to Hawes.  They exchange a look a deep breath.  Tommy then goes for it.  His hands extend slowly toward the coffin.  More THUNDER GROWLS.
slip into the narrow space beneath the coffin lid.

head_text.subj: PRESS IN TIGHT ON HAWES' FACE

text: He winces and bites his lip.

head_text.subj: PRESS IN TIGHT ON TOMMY'S FACE

text: With all the courage he can muster, Tommy strains to do t deed.  He yanks the casket open!
With a BRILLIANT FLASH OF LIGHTNING, the lid swings open reveal the huge decomposing body of JASON.  His HEAD IS COMPLETELY COVERED BY AN ARMY OF DISGUSTING MAGGOTS.
He fights with his stomach to keep his dinner down..

He turns and stares down at his nemesis. A slow hatred be to build.  We PRESS IN on Tommy, HEARING his horrid memor His sister screams, NO, TOMMY, NO while 10-year-old Tommy kills Jason, repeating, "DIE, DIE!"
As he listens, his eyes well up with a violent rage.
Tommy looks around vengefully.  Seeing an old fence a few yards away, he heads for it.  Hawes is confused by his actions.
Hey, where are you going?
Without a word, he storms over to the rusty fence. He gra one of the spearlike posts and pulls it out.
With fire in his eyes, Tommy stalks Jason with the weapon THUNDER ROARS ABOVE.
rushes up to Tommy, greatly alarmed.
What's that for? Tommy, what are you doin', boy?!
The boy storms right past him.
Tommy glares down hatefully at this monster who has destr his loved ones and his life. Raising the spear, he explod and jumps down.
You bastard!
As he lands in the grave, Tommy plunges the spear down wi a mighty force. THUNDER AND LIGHTNING BLAST HELLISHLY.
penetrates deep into Jason's chest.
Oh, shit.
withdraws it, then angrily rams it down again and again.
The force of the blows causes many of the numerous maggot start dropping off his face. Grossly decayed flesh is illuminated the LIGHTNING.
Exhausted, his rage finally vented, he drives the spear i Jason for the last time.
Over the boy's shoulder we see the long spear extending o of Jason's cold heart.
Recovering from his tantrum, Tommy climbs out of the grav Hawes stares open-mouthed at his friend.
Boy, he must've really messed you over.
reaches down, picks up Jason's hockey mask, and stares at
It seems to stare back evilly at him.
Yeah.  Fuck you, Jason.
Tommy, knowing the nightmare is finally over, tosses the into the grave.  He then bends down and starts to uncap t gas can.

Without warning, the sky EXPLODES with a mass of LIGHTNIN One of the BOLTS OF ELECTRICITY is drawn to the spear as a lightning rod.  SPARKS fly as the spear is struck and electrified.  Tommy and Hawes dive for cover.
Uncovering their heads, they look skyward in fear.  Quick Tommy gets to his feet and goes for the troublesome spear

The unintended lightning rod is still smoking a little fr the blast.  He touches it.  It's hot.  He pulls out a pai gloves from his jacket.  Putting them on, he then attempt remove the spear.  He can't get proper leverage.  So Tomm jumps down into Jason's grave.
He struggles to pull the spear out.  It's apparently driv into the bottom of the coffin as well.  Hawes leans down the grave.
Let's just get the hell out of here.  My heart can't take any more of this.
Jason's wicked eyes glare at Tommy.

The boy, of course, does not see what's about to occur. finally yanks the spear out, and throws it up onto the gr Slowly he removes his gloves and tosses them to Hawes.  H starts to climb out.  JASON SPRINGS UP FROM BEHIND AND GR HIM.
He goes crazy with hysteria.  He starts to run.
Tommy fights for his life as Jason tries to pull him down into the grave.  He manages to kick Jason back down long enough to climb out.
scrambles for the gas can as the STORM CLOUDS DETONATE AB He gets it open, turns around, and starts throwing it on rising corpse of Jason.
The gas splashes all over him as he keeps coming!
He backs up as Jason stalks him.  Knowing there's enough now on his predator, he drops the can.
He's coming closer.
Panicking, he searches his pockets for the matches.  He f them.  As he pulls them out, the STORM CLOUDS ERUPT WITH INCREDIBLE DOWNPOUR.
stops as the rain drenches him.  Maggots start to wash of him as he stares at his helpless victim.
He tries desperately to light a match in this pounding ra
struggling with the soaked matchbook.
starts to close in.  Suddenly HAWES EMERGES FROM BEHIND, HOLDING UP A SHOVEL.  He HOLLERS as he swings it.
He WHACKS the back of Jason's head as hard as he can.  It doesn't even faze his undead superkiller.
His arm lunges forcefully at Hawes' chest.

head_text.subj: JASON'S HAND, CLUTCHING HAWES' HEART, BURST OUT HAWES' BA

text: Hawes' body falls back into Jason's grave.
As Hawes lands in the coffin, the lid shuts over him.
Horrified and weaponless, he runs like hell.
Seeing his victim escaping, Jason whips around and looks a weapon.  He goes for the nefarious spear.  Something in grave then catches his attention.
Tommy races out of the cemetery to his pickup.  He jumps the truck and takes off in the rain.

With his back to us, Jason dons his beloved hockey mask a picks up the spear.  We PRESS IN TIGHT ON HIM as he turns around to face us.  FREEZE FRAME.  Meaner, stronger, and unstoppable than ever before...
Tommy's old pickup SCREECHES UP before us.  He leaps from truck and races for the office door.  The sign by it read "Forest Green County Sheriff's Dept."
Tommy BURSTS into the room.

SHERIFF MICHAEL GARRIS is a hard-ass Vietnam vet who, at forty-three, has "seen enough trouble and don't want no more."  That's why he took this job a few years back.  Ha just nodded off, Tommy's entrance startles him.  He leaps his feet, gun drawn with lightning speed.
Shocked by the sheriff's sudden aggression, Tommy instant throws up his hands.
Don't shoot.  Please.
He relaxes, seeing it's just a teenager.  But he's still pissed off as he holsters his gun.
You in show business, kid?  You sure know how to make an entrance.
The hyper boy rushes toward the sheriff.
You gotta do something!  Jason's alive!  He killed my friend, now he's coming for me!!
Jason is coming.  Gripping the spear before him, he heads toward us.
(sitting back) Now you better cool out a minute, boy.  You already almost got your head blown to pieces.
(demanding) Will you listen, dammit!
(stands up) Don't piss me off, junior.  Or I will repaint this office with your brains.
Tommy tries to control his emotions and sound rational.
Jason is alive.  We dug up his body.  I was gonna cremate it and...
(smirks and interrupts) Hold it.  Whoa... What's your name, son?
(quickly) Tommy Jarvis.  We gotta do something.  He's even more powerful now that...
The sheriff circles the desk and approaches Tommy.
Aren't you the kid whose mother and friends were....
(nods) Yeah.  Jason murdered them and...
(cutting him off again) And you've been at some psychiatric clinic ever since, haven't you?
(catching his drift) Yes, but they released me because...
The door behind him BURSTS OPEN.
Rains stopped.  Ya owe me that five-spot, partner.
DEPUTY RICK COLONE hurries in with an armload of fast foo Dark, mid-thirties, and a little on the short side.  He i surprised to see someone here this late.
Sorry.  I didn't...
Sheriff Garris waves his deputy in.
(sarcastic) No problem, Rick.  Come over and meet a former resident here, Tommy Jarvis.  He's got some kinda prank going about...
(explodes) There's no time for this bullshit...
He bolts across the office and grabs one of the rifles fr the rack.
Jason's got to be stopped.
Both lawmen drive for the crazy kid. Their food flies as struggle to get the rifle away from the strong youth.
Finally the deputy pins Tommy's arms from behind.  The sheriff yanks the rifle away.
(pointing at Tommy) Now that's what know in the books as screwin' the pooch. (to deputy) Iron this punk.
Tommy fights to get away from the deputy, who throws him the cell.  The iron bars are slammed shut.
(struggling) No... Ya gotta listen.  Jason's coming back here.  He's after me. I tried to destroy him but I fucked up....
He leans in toward Tommy's cell.

You got that right.  Now you listen up.  I'm sorry for what happened to you and your folks years ago.  But no one in Forest Green wants to be reminded of what that maniac did here.  That's why they changed the name to Forest Green.  People want to forget this was once Crystal Lake.  And they don't need some kid stirring up Jason shit again.
He paces the cell in wild frustration.
Why didn't you cremate him?!

(impatiently) They were gonna!  But some asshole sent a lot of money to give Jason and his mother a decent burial. Now look, you just lie down and get some rest.  In the morning I'll call that clinic and see if they...
Tommy grabs the bars and pleads with him.
If you'd just go to the cemetery, you'll see I'm not lying.
Either you go to sleep or I'll come in there and put you out.
(defiantly) You're gonna be sorry you didn't listen to me.
(more defiantly) You're gonna be sorry if you don't shut the fuck up.
A funky VW Bug bounces along a narrow muddy road.  LAUGHT is HEARD from within.

A likable couple in their mid-twenties are obviously lost LIZBETH drives and giggles, slap-happy from the long trip late hour.  Her boyfriend, DARREN, struggles to read the in the dim car light.  A huge pothole causes him to bang head on the roof.
Will you slow down?  It's hard enough to read this thing.
(trying not to laugh) Well, who told me to take this cow path?
You admit the sign did say "Camp Forest Green," with an arrow pointing this way.
I admit nothing without talking to my lawyer.
throws down the map with a growl.
So much for the head counselors ever finding the camp on their own.  I say we stop the car, get out, and start screaming for help.
The car comes to a grinding halt.
(sighs) I was just kidding, Lizbeth.
He looks at his girlfriend, who is staring fearfully out windshield.  Darren turns to look.
Standing in the middle of the road, illuminated by the headlights... JASON.  He holds the deadly spear before hi
Needless to say, Lizbeth is becoming more afraid.
Darren, we better turn around.
Why?
Why?  Because I've seen enough horror movies to know masked weirdos are never friendly.
She starts to back up.  Darren looks behind him, then gra the wheel.
Wait!
almost rolls off the narrow road into a water-filled gull
He stares intensely at Lizbeth.
There's no way we can do this... (he looks at Jason) ...If the car drops into that gully, we'll never get it out.
just stands his ground.  He ain't backin' down.
keeps her eye on the evil-looking stranger.
Do you have any alternate suggestions?
He bites his lip nervously.
Yeah... We're gonna scare him.
(taken aback) We're gonna scare him?!
Darren attempts to pump up a macho attitude.
That's right.  Just drive toward him.  He'll move.  Nobody wants to die.
(staring at Darren) That's a freakin' fact.  Least of all us.
Just drive.  He'll get out of our way.
She shakes her head, not believing she's actually going t this.
Her foot stomps it down.
We race toward Jason, who doesn't budge.
Her foot slams on the brakes.
The car skids to a stop, inches from the stock-still kill
turns to her now-less-than-confident boyfriend.
(sarcastically) Yeah, that really scared the shit out of him.
He gets pissed.  He leans over and BLASTS the HORN.
Jason gets pissed too.  He swings the spear and SMASHES O a headlight.
(shocked) Oh, jeez.
(starting to shift) That's it.  We're driving this baby back to town... in reverse.
Darren, now angered, grabs her hand as she starts to shif
The hell we are.
Darren opens it and pulls out a .22 revolver.
stares at the gun, then at Darren, in shock.
Where'd you get that?
Darren gets out of the car.  He's scared shitless, but tr not to show it.
Don't worry about it.  Just stay cool.
(trying to maintain) Stay cool?  You ain't Dirty Harry. Now stop it.
watches Darren's every move.

head_text.subj: DOLLY BACK ON DARREN TO JASON

text: With great apprehension he heads toward Jason, holding th gun out with both hands.  He clears his nervous throat.
All right, scumbag.  Get out of the road.
From over Jason's shoulder we see Darren cock the trigger aim.
Now!
Instantly Jason rams the spear into the other headlight! is now a very dark figure in front of the car.
screams, and shouts at her boyfriend.
Darren, get in here right now! He'll kill you!
He gets a bit cocky, knowing he's the one with the gun. glances back at his girl.
(loudly) Not if I get him first.
suddenly CHARGES him!
Darren fires.  But the bullet either misses or it just doesn't affect Jason.  He thrusts the spear forward.
drives right through Darren's stomach and out his back!
She goes hysterical.
Effortlessly, he lifts up the impaled boy and tosses his body aside.  Jason then turns his murderous gaze on Lizbe
Lizbeth gasps.  Quickly, she tries to drive away.  Seeing something coming, she dives across the other seat.  JASON

head_text.subj: SPEAR SMASHES THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD AND IMPALES ITSELF I

text: The terrified girl crawls out of the open passenger door. She falls into the muddy and water-filled gully alongside road.
He withdraws his weapon from the car and heads for his vi
struggles to stand.  She slips, badly twisting or breakin her ankle.  Looking back quickly, she is horrified.
with spear poised, he's coming!

Knowing it's hopeless to run, she tries a last-ditch effo to barter for her life.  Lying in the muddy water, Lizbet digs into her jacket.  She pulls out her wallet and remov her money and credit cards.
(crying) Don't kill me, please.  You can have these.
She looks up and offers her valuables.
Jason is gone.
She is amazed.  Where did he go?  What's the difference - she's safe.  WRONG.  As she looks behind her, JASON'S FEE SLAM DOWN IN THE WATER NEXT TO HER HEAD.  She opens her m to scream.
He raises the spear and RAMS IT DOWN TOWARD HER FACE!  A spine-chilling CRUNCH is HEARD.
Jason stands over his victim... Her body floats on the fi water, but her head is drive down underneath.  BLOOD begi to bubble up around the extended spear.
A lifeless hand releases the money and credit cards it wa clutching. We follow the floating American Express card along the no bloody stream... Remember, don't leave home without it.
Tommy is asleep on the cot in his cell.  Suddenly the LOU SOUNDS of the DOOR OPENING and YOUNG VOICES startle him a

Entering from the bright sunshine are the sheriff and fou kids in their late teens.  Teasing, holding on to the arm her sheriff father, is MEGAN.  She is a cute and feisty 1 year-old.  Her three friends, PAULA, a warm and personabl girl with a short new-wave haircut; SISSY is black, sexy very boy-crazy; and CORT, with his long hair and heavy me T-shirt, is always ready to rock.
(to sheriff) Come on, Dad.  You could have Rick drive down Cunningham Road and look for them.
Megan, my deputies have more important things to do than look for camp counselors with car trouble.
Sheriff, couldn't you like put our an all-points bulletin for them? That would be really wicked decent.
The sheriff shoots him a look.
It's just that Darren and Lizbeth are in charge of organizing and setting up the new campgrounds.
All the little kids arrive today. We're not ready to deal with that alone.
He sits down behind his desk and picks up the phone.
I sympathize with you kids.  The best I can do is call the station in Carpenter and have them keep a lookout for them.
I got a bad feeling of what might've happened to them.
Everyone turns to look.
is gripping the cell's bars.  His eyes connect with Megan
You've got to convince the sheriff to look for your friends. Hopefully, they're fine.  But there's a very good chance that Jason...
jumps up angrily.
Shut up.
Megan, attracted to the good-looking prisoner, walks towa his cell.
Jason who?
(ordering her) Megan, get away from him.  He's dangerous.
She stops a few feet from the cell.
(sincerely) I'm not dangerous, believe me. Jason is out there.  He's looking for me.  But there's every possibility he'll return to the camp where it all started.
The sheriff stomps over toward Tommy.
(clenching his teeth) I told you to shut...
(nervously) You mean the Jason of Camp Blood?
Yes!
No!... (to kids) ... You kids better leave.  This boy here is not well and I need to talk to him in private.
But, Dad, we...
(very firmly) Megan, take your friends back to the camp.  I'll let you know if I hear anything about your counselors.
She wants to argue, but the look in her father's eye tell her she'd better cool it.  She takes one more look at Tom as she approaches her father.
(wisecracking) Don't beat him up too bad, he's kinda cute.
This really steams the sheriff.
Megan, leave!
They stumble out awkwardly as Megan struts away with a co Lauren Bacall swagger.
On the door is closed, the steely-eyed sheriff leans in c to Tommy's face.
I was going to call the clinic and have them collect your ass.  But I don't want you around here any longer poisoning my daughter, or anyone else, with your warped mind.
(extremely concerned) But they have to be warned, Sheriff.  Jason will return to the area that's familiar.  No matter what you call it, it's still Camp Crystal Lake to him.
walks away, not listening to Tommy.  He straps on his hol and puts on his coat.

(deadly serious) We're gonna escort you and that shit-pile pickup of yours to the edge of my jurisdiction.... (he picks up his rifle) ....Then we'll say goodbye and we'll never see your deranged butt around here again... (he cocks rifle) ...Right?
pushes off the bars in frustration and paces the cell lik caged animal.

A large clump of thick bushes.  Someone's moving behind t We TRACK along, following the rustles.  It stops. We HOLD WAIT.  SUDDENLY THE BUSHES PART ABRUPTLY.  A bespectacled little man in Army fatigues and camouflage makeup pokes h head out at us.  ROY, wearing protective goggles, looks r left, then hides back in the brush.

We follow TWO OTHER BUSINESSMEN decked out in green jungl fatigues, looking like out-of-shape Rambos.  STAN and LAR are both carrying handguns, watching for any movement aro them.  They, too, wear goggles.
(quietly) Once we nail Roy, that's it. Victory is ours.
This is taking forever.  I'm starving.
That's your problem, Larry. That's why your sales are always below quota.  Your instinct to eat is stronger than your instinct to win.
(insulted) My ass.
Yeah, that's fat too.
He watches motionlessly as the two arguing men pass.  The of course, don't see him.
(outraged) You become a whole other person when you're out here, Stan.  And I don't like it.
(arrogant) This is a man's game.  Requiring a man's cunning and intelligence...

head_text.subj: SUDDENLY, A FIGURE EXPLODES OUT OF THE BRUSH.

text: They react in terror.
A goggle-wearing woman, also in Army fatigues, has her revolver pointed at them.  KATIE fires at them.
are splattered by red-paint pellets.  Boy, are they pisse
grins triumphantly.
....with a woman's touch.
Now wait a second!  I thought Burt shot you.
(turns all around) See any paint?... (cocky) ...Sorry, guys, I did in Mr. Commando.  Survival is the name of the game, and that flag is mine.
As they walk away, Larry looks at his paint-smeared chest
(to Stan) Never should've let her play.
It's a damn company executive game, and she's a damn company exec.
(motherly) Now, now, boys.  Don't be spoilsports.
silently watches.  He then heads for them!
The freshly painted and beautifully renovated cabin retre gleams in the bright sunlight.  Even the lake itself shim tranquilly, free of any memories of its horrid past.
Megan, Cort, Paula, and Sissy carry food supplies from th car to the cabin.
I'm getting worried.
About Jason.
No...about Darren and Lizbeth. They should have at least called. Don't you think, Megan?...Megan.
Megan's mind is definitely on something--or someone--else
(breaking out of it) Huh?  Yeah, what?
(giggles) This girl's back in the cell with her prisoner of love.
Megan hits her playfully.
What's it to ya?
Don't be playin' with no crazy jailbird.  Those dudes are bad news.
Yeah?  How would you know?
I've been around long enough...to see plenty on TV.
Everyone laughs or groans at Sissy.
I don't know, Megan.  He seemed pretty weird with all that Jason stuff.
Yeah, he was really into it.
(playing with them) Maybe he was telling the truth.
Everyone stops and stares at her in disbelief.

(keeping the ruse going) Just because our parents keep telling us that Jason was only a legend, doesn't mean it wasn't true.  What if Jason did come back here... (dramatically) ...And you know what today's date is, don't you?
Each of their faces registers a different expression, wondering if Megan is serious or not.
looks past them at something, then smiles.
(slyly) I can think of only one thing even more terrifying.
(nervously) What?
She points behind them.  They turn to look.
pulls up into the camp.  The doors fly open.  A group of screaming youngsters pile out.
stare in dread.  How are they gonna handle this?
I think I'd rather deal with ol' Jason.
A MACHETE IS SEEN.  We follow the deadly weapon as it's carried through the woods.  Reaching some heavy brush, it hacks away at it.

BURT, a real Rambo/Commando clone in paint-splattered fatigues, whacks angrily at the brushes.  Of all the woul hunters, he looks like he takes the game almost too seriously.  He wears a commando belt loaded with a surviv knife, devil darts and his machete sheath.  Like his partners, he too is a sore loser.  As he hacks away, he mumbles curses about this "stupid game."
He raises the machete higher as he attacks the defenseles bushes.  SUDDENLY, A HORRIBLY DISFIGURED HAND GRABS HIS H STOPPING THE MACHETE IN MID-SWING.
Shocked, Burt whips around, and gasps at the masked Jason

Jason's iron grip turns the hunter's hand with the machet toward his bug-eyed face.  Jason forces the helpless man stare at the weapon in his own hand that's about to take life.  He then PLUNGES the razor-sharp blade through his
Burt's corpse drops before us.  The gaping wound through throat bubbles out bloody air bubbles.  His eyes stare lifelessly at us.
The crusty old CARETAKER stares down in utter horror. His bloodshot, alcoholic eyes widen at what they see.
Oh, shit.  Shit-SHIT!
He stands over Jason's dug-up grave, cursing at what has happened.
Taking out a pint of Whiskey from his coat, he takes a st slug and winces.  With hangover equilibrium, he paces, nervous and afraid.
Oh-hh.  Why me?...I know he's gonna blame me for this.
Martin looks around quickly.  He decides to cover up the grave.  He starts throwing all the evidence into the hole then, grabbing the shovel, begins filling it in.
(become more frightened) Damn.  Why Jason?  Mothers could have their pick... (he gestures) ...of any of these other graves.
Shovel-loads of dirt and mud slam down on the coffin. Haw foot is seen sticking out of the casket.
Shitheads couldn't even stick him back in right.  Well, I ain't gonna touch the slimy sucker.
He's beginning to sweat as he works faster.
He can't find out.  He'll think I ain't doin' my job.  I need that money...He won't find out... (looking around fearfully) ...No one's gonna know...I need my money.
Tommy drives with incredible anxiety down the forest road He glances up into the rear-view mirror.
Sheriff Garris and his deputy, Rick, are following close behind in their police car.
Keeping a stern eye on Tommy, the sheriff shakes his head
(to deputy) It's kinda frightening to think that a kid like that can go so far over the edge.  Jason really screwed up the poor sonofabitch's mind.
(amazed) He really believes Jason's still alive, doesn't he?
(nods and sighs) But that's no what worries me the most...It's how far he'll go to try and prove it.
Tommy's pickup, with the sheriff's car right on his tail, roars down the road.
Roy has still not been found.  Hiding behind a tree, the little man with funny-shaped glasses watches for any unse assassins.

In his ill-fighting fatigues, he dashes comically from be one tree to another.  His foot catches in some vines and takes a terrific pratfall.  The paint-pellet gun flies fr his hand and vanishes into the fallen leaves.
He scrambles on his hands and knees to find his weapon. Panicking he'll be seen and shot, Roy starts to whimper a searches.
Slowly we MOVE toward the vulnerable little man with his to us.

A fire some time ago has blackened the trees and ground i this area.  Katie, Stan and Larry walk along, looking for their missing players.  Holding up the other team's flag victoriously, Katie hollers out:
Come on, you guys!  The game's over!!
(disgruntled) You don't know for sure.  What about Roy?  Nobody's seen him.
(cocky) Of course not.  If he hasn't already accidentally pelleted himself, I'm sure he's lost.
Yeah, but the game's not over until it's over.
(going along) That's right.
Katie starts to counter, when she thinks she hears someth She stops them abruptly.
Shh-hh.  Wait a second.  What was that?
Everyone freezes, listening very intently.  A LONG WAIT.
All three stand stock-still, looking around and listening
Not hearing a thing, Stan relaxes.
Ahh, nothing.
(loud whisper) I could swear I heard...
Jason wants to play army, too.  He quickly withdraws the machete from his newly acquired commando belt.  With one violent slice, the blade slashes their throats.
The razor-sharp machete opens up all three throats almost simultaneously.  It happens so fast, they barely have tim even gasp.
THREE HANDS DROP OFF, FOLLOWED BY COLLAPSING BODIES.  Jas watches them fall, then looks up at something.
Terrified beyond belief is Roy!  He stands a few yards aw in a small clearing.
He wastes no time as he stalks the final hunter.
So incredibly frightened, he doesn't think as he raises h gun at Jason and fires.
The blood/red-paint pellet makes a direct hit on Jason's chest.  He stops and glances down at this annoying mess.
As he looks up at Roy, he is even more pissed off.  He LU for him.
screams, drops the gun, and runs for his life.
He is hell-bent on catching this nerd.
Tears of terror are welling up as the poor guy races.  Ja is seen a short distance behind, machete poised and ready Roy glances back quickly, then screams as he heads throug the ugly charred forest.
Oh, God, help me!  Somebody, help!!  He's trying to kill me!!
We are TRAVELING toward the large sign and arrow pointing left.
Tommy stares at the sign and the approaching turnoff.  He glances up in his rear-view mirror again.  Biting his lip decides to go for it.
Tommy's pickup makes a sudden left turn and heads up the toward the cemetery.
(exploding) Fuckin' A, what'd I tell ya!... (to deputy) ...Hit the noise and cherries.
Rick turns on the siren and the red lights.
The police car SCREECHES left and roars after Tommy.
Tommy gets nervous hearing the siren BLARING, but instead pulling over, he speeds up.
(vengeful) I'm getting real tired of this maniac.
Maybe we better call that psychiatric clinic.
(coldly) Better call an ambulance first.
The sheriff's car accelerates and gains on the pickup.  T high-speed chase continues down the narrow dirt road.

Tommy's old pickup SKIDS to a stop in front of the open gates.  He leaps out of the truck as the sheriff SCREECHE next to him.  We CRANE UP past the "Eternal Rest" sign as Tommy races into the old cemetery.  The sheriff and his deputy are running close behind.
sprints across the bone yard in the direction of Jason's grave.  In his eyes there is now the hope that they'll se he's telling the truth.
We HEAD toward where Jason's open grave was.
He squints his eyes.  Maybe he's in the wrong area.  He s down to look around.  TOMMY IS VIOLENTLY TACKLED BY THE SHERIFF.
Angry and out of breath, the sheriff pins him down to cuf him.  Tommy struggles to get up.
I gotta show you Jason's grave.
(clenching his teeth) I've seen it.
(desperate) Please, Sheriff.  You'll see we dug it up.
Finally handcuffing him, the sheriff yanks him to his fee Gripping Tommy's arm with one hand, he points at somethin
(sarcastically) Well, he must've got chilly in the night and pulled the dirt back over.
Tommy looks around to where the sheriff is pointing.  The is astounded by what he sees.
About twelve yards away are Jason's and his mother's tombstones.  From this distance, it is impossible to tell that the chunks of lawn over Jason's grave have been repl
Tommy shakes his head in utter disbelief.
That's not right.  Somebody covered it up... (going toward it) ...I gotta see it...
The sheriff yanks him back.  The deputy pulls his .357 revolver with a laser scope attached.  He aims at Tommy's head.
(very icy) Now see what you've done.  You've made my deputy draw his revolver. That could be a serious headache for you.  He's been dyin' to try out his new mail-order laser scope.
The deputy presses his gun's grip.  Instantly a tiny, bri red beam appears on Tommy's temple.
It's a damn impressive piece of high-tech weaponry... Wherever the red dot goes... a bullet is sure to follow.
He stares, fearing for his life, at the stolid deputy.
What's the problem, Sheriff?
The old caretaker rushes awkwardly toward them.  Immediat the sheriff whips Tommy around.  He drags him back toward car as Rick quickly holsters his gun.
Nothing, Martin.  Just a vagrant kid.  We got it under control.
As they leave, Tommy looks back at the old man.
(demanding) Who covered up Jason's grave?!
Martin stops abruptly and tries to hide his nervousness.
What!?  What are you talking about?
The sheriff pulls Tommy along even faster.
Don't concern yourself, Martin. This boy needs treatment.  We're taking care of it.  Sorry for the disturbance.
(screaming) Jason's not in his coffin!  Hawes is!  Dig it up!  You gotta dig it up!!
He watches with extreme uneasiness as Tommy is thrown int the back of the squad car.  The deputy gets into Tommy's pickup and follows the sheriff's car.
Pulling out his near-empty bottle of Jack Daniel's, he do it all.  With a noisy exhale, Martin glances back at Jaso grave.
(mumbles to self) Dig it up?... (he snickers) ...Hell, what kinda butt-hole does he think I am!
As we TIGHTEN in, the large chunks of rearranged lawn are visible.  We HOLD on Jason's tombstone.
A large group of cheering female youngsters.
The little girls sit on two large picnic tables.  Megan stands before them.
...And then after that we'll swim, hike, and have lots of fun together.  Okay?
The youngsters squeal even louder.

head_text.subj: SISSY AND PAULA SITTING ON CABIN STEPS

text: Sissy mimes sticking her finger down her throat in disgus Paula stifles a laugh and slaps Sissy's knee.  She looks around.
So where's Cort gone off to?
Are you ready?  He's taken our young men off to teach them my favorites sport.
(smirking) Which is?
(sexily) Boy scouting.
(laughing) You gotta be kidding!
(sarcastically) You gotta be kidding!
Cort is kneeling on the path, positioning two rocks.  He' surrounded by a group of bored, arms-folded, pre-teen boy
(trying hard) No, seriously... the Indian scout would arrange the rocks in such a way that like only his fellow Indians would know.  You know, which way he went... (no response) ...You know?
leans into another equally bored youngster, BILLY.
If this is as exciting as it gets, we're in big trouble, dude.

JASON STALKS THROUGH THE BLACKENED WOODS.  He heads towar us, wearing a commando belt displaying a knife and devil darts, a bloody machete in his hand.  This undead killing machine keeps coming.  There's a slight fog moving in as night approaches.
Off on the side of the road, Sheriff Garris opens his backseat door.  He pulls Tommy out of the vehicle.  Gruff he turns him around and uncuffs him.
Whipping him back around, the Sheriff grabs him by his sh and pulls him uncomfortably close.
I don't find it amusing that the nut house you belong in thinks you're responsible enough to leave here unescorted.  In fact, it gripes my ass.
Tommy just stares coldly into his eyes.
(letting him go) You've been damn lucky, pisshead. With all the grief you've caused me and my partner, you should be leaving wearing your balls as earrings.
walks up and slaps Tommy's car keys into his hand.  Tommy looks up, down at his keys, then back at the wicked, smil deputy.
I think we should do it to him anyway.
The sheriff leans in and taps Tommy's earlobes with his i fingers.
Naw.  But if we see ol' Tommy ever again... you can guarantee it.
Both lawmen turn and climb back into their car.  Tommy wa there as they pull out and drive away.
He watches as they disappear down the highway.  Slowly th boy's stubborn determination returns.  He rushes toward h old pickup.  Behind it, the SUN IS SETTING.
The campgrounds are peaceful and quiet.  A foggy haze cov everything.  As tranquil as it seems, we feel uneasy.  Is somebody watching from the woods.
Two rows of sleeping youngsters in their cots are seen.
The same.  The little girls' faces reflect pleasant dream
Paula and Sissy are seated at a card table, playing the b game CLUE.  Paula keeps looking toward the window, troubl by something.  Sissy rolls the die and moves her token al the board.
(excited) Okay, okay.  I suggest that the crime was committed in the bedroom, by Colonel Mustard, with the knife.
(preoccupied) Huh?  Oh, come on, Sis.  I'm tellin' ya, we can't play Clue with just two people.

head_text.subj: SLOWLY WE TIGHTEN IN ON THEM

text: Why not?  I used to play it alone. I love murder games.  Have you ever played The Consulting Detective?
(fidgety) No...Did Megan say when she's coming back from her...visit?
Of course not.  She probably took him a loaf of bread with a saw hidden in it.  I still don't get it.  Why him?  I mean, he's cute alright, but...
Paula smirks.
(quickly) Isn't that enough?
Sissy laughs and nods.
You're right.  And for the area, that even makes him overqualified.
Paula then reaches for the phone.  TIGHTEN IN ON HER.

I'm gonna call her at the ol' jail house.  Maybe her dad has found out what happened to Darren and Lizbeth by now... (she starts dialing) ...I can't believe they haven't called.  I say if they're not here by morning, we send all the kids home.  We're not prepared to run this place by ourselves.

head_text.subj: SUDDENLY, A CHILD'S HORRIFIED SCREAMS ECHO THROUGH THE CA

text: Hanging up the phone, Paula races out the door, followed Sissy.
WE FOLLOW BEHIND Sissy and Paula as they run in the direc of the scream.  We follow them up the steps of the girls' dormitory cabin.
As Paula and Sissy burst in, a LITTLE GIRL in pajamas rus toward them.  She points at a cot across the way.
(terrified) She saw a monster.
Who did?
She looks to where the little girl is pointing.
Huddled up on her cot and pressed against the wall is NAN The sweet-faced nine-year-old is frightened out of her wi Her big blue eyes are filled with tears.
Behind Paula and Sissy, the other children stare wide-eye Nancy.  Paula approaches her gently.
(reassuringly) Hi.  Everything's all right now. We're here.
(awkwardly going along) Yeah, we're here.
Paula crouches down next to Nancy's cot.  Sissy stands ne to her friend.  Nancy has still not stopped trembling.
(softly) So what happened?
(holding back tears) There was this monster.  He was after me.  He wanted to kill me.
Where...?
Everywhere.
(smiling) You mean you had a bad dream.
(shakes her head) No, he was real.  Like on TV.
In motherly fashion, Paula wipes Nancy's tears and tucks back under the blanket.
Okay, listen...what's your name, sweetie?
(sniffling) Nancy.
(warmly) Well, Nancy, I'm Paula... remember?  This is Sissy, and we're gonna be right out there all night so nothing can hurt you. Okay?...
The child nods tentatively.
...Good.  So no more bad dreams can come around here, huh?
(faintly) No more.
Paula smiles lovingly at her, then stands.
As Paula and Sissy start to leave, Sissy gets cocky addressing the others.
Now you all go back to Z-land. We're on the job and ya don't have to worry about shit...
Paula nudges her for her choice of language.
...What?  I'm sure they hear worse at home.
Paula looks outside, then turns to Sissy.
(quietly) I just realized something. Where's Cort?  I haven't seen him for hours.
(disgusted) I don't know.  He called somebody, then took off.
He didn't say anything?
Yeah, he was gonna check out "things that go bump in the night."

A lone RV bounces and pumps to the beat of LOUD ROCK MUSI within.  Surrounded by a heavy fog, bright light beams fr the windows of the mobile home.  A cord extends from the vehicle and is plugged into the power outlet of this isol trailer campground.

HEAVY-METAL MUSIC BLASTS as Cort and a savagely sexy girl JILL, make love to the beat.  With her on top, Cort is re getting his "bump in the night."  He just lies back and enjoys he skilled technique.
She moans and bites her lip with erotic pleasure, never missing a beat with the music.  Jill even bumps and grind perfectly to the song's drum breaks.
(very hot) They're the best.  The best... (panting) ...You gotta keep it up till the end of the song.
nearing his climactic moment, strains to avoid it.
(breathing heavy) I'm tryin'...how much longer?
Jill bends forward, laying her soft breasts on his chest. She whispers seductively in his ear:
Only ten more minutes.
Poor Cort's eyes widen.  He'll never make it to the final chord.
From a short distance back, we watch the rockin', rollin' SUDDENLY, JASON STEPS SHOCKINGLY INTO FRAME.
He stands in the foggy woods and watches too.  He doesn't like it.  And he moves to do something about it.
The rock tune now BLARES out a WILD GUITAR SOLO.
She gyrates wildly along with every screeching note.
His face contorts wildly as he tries to control his near- exploding passion.  He's just about to...
Jason's hand grabs the cord and tears it out, leaving the plug SPARKING in the outlet.
The RV's bright lights, music and bouncing instantly reta and CEASE.
Oh, fuck.
(passion relieved) Oh ye-aaah.
Dim moonlight spills in through the windows.  Jill jumps Cort and starts to investigate the problem.
Wait a second, I'll... (realizing, angrily) ...Cort, you didn't already...
sits quickly.
(defensively) I thought that was the end of the song.
(frustrated) Great.  Just great.
She stumbles through the RV.  Shivering, she puts on her and heads to the AC power switch.
If this thing is burned out, friggin' Horace will ground my butt.
Who's Horace?
(disgusted) My friggin' stepfather and asshole- in-residence.
Jill flips the switch a couple times.  Nothing.  She pres her face against the window and looks out.
The power cord is seen laying on the ground below.
How did that happen?
has pulled the blankets around himself to fight the cold.
What?
(almost demanding) Go out and plug the cord back in.
What?  Who pulled it out?!
Jill stomps toward him.
(sarcastically) Smokey the friggin' bear.  I don't know, just do it.
Nervously, he starts to get dressed.
The door opens tentatively.  Cort sticks his head out and slowly looks around.
Will you hurry up!  I gotta get this fuckmobile back before Horace finds out I took it.
(jumping out) Alright, alright.
We TRACK with Cort as he walks around the RV, watching everything around him.  It's getting tense.
Apprehensively, Cort approaches the cord and picks it up. keeps staring out at the surrounding drifting fog.

Without looking at it, the jittery boy starts to plug in cord.  He then notices the torn-out plug and frayed cord. Cort gasps.  He turns to call to Jill.  HE BANGS INTO SOM RIGHT BEHIND HIM...it's Jill.
(irritated) What are you doing?... (seeing the cord) ...What happened to it?
Cort hands her the damaged cord.
(very scared) I don't know... (he heads for the door) ...But unless you wanna look exactly like it, I say we make this place a memory.
Jill looks down at it.
Close up, the horribly ripped and torn cord end does look quite grotesque.
She cans the foggy night and a deadly fear now grips her. Slowly, then picking up speed, she follows after Cort.
has stopped in the RV's doorway.  Jill rushes up, and tur to look at what he's staring at.
(straining to see) I think someone's out there.
The woods are still, with the exception of the drifting f Is that a tree in the shadows, or...?
pushes him into the mobile home.
(scared) I don't wanna know.
She climbs in, slams the door, and LOCKS it.
Cort jumps into the driver's seat.  He tries to start the car.  IT'S DEAD.  He looks at Jill in terror.
This can't be.
Jill shakes her head at him.
It isn't.
She calmly turns the power switch over to "BATTERY".
tries the ignition again.  It starts up.  He grins at her
(impatiently) Are you gonna drive or not?
Quickly he shifts and ROARS backward.  Jill is thrown to floor.  Items fall off the counters.
In a cloud of dust, the huge RV races backwards.
We FOLLOW AFTER the vehicle as it peels out of the campgrounds.
Jill is now sent flying back toward the camper.  She land the bed.  She sends a burning stars at the back of Cort's head.
Cort LAUGHS LOUDLY as he races down the bumpy dirt road.
tries to control her temper.  Enough things have gone wro tonight without having this idiot destroy her old man's R
(standing up) That's it.  Pull over.  I'm drivin'.
(cocky) No way... (turns on radio) ...I wanna rock!
as she heads toward him.  WITHOUT WARNING, JASON EXPLODES OF THE BATHROOM.  He yanks her to him.  The door slams sh on them.
His head bobs enthusiastically to the LOUD ROCK MUSIC.  H whoops, then looks up at the rear-view mirror.  Not seein Jill, he turns around and looks.
Jill is not there.  But a RUCKUS can be HEARD coming from tiny bathroom.
(feeling his oats) Sounds like you're havin' fun in there!  Need any company?!
Jason's viselike grip squeezes her throat.  She gasps and gags as his fingers begin to meet.  Her nose bleeds.
His soulless eyes stare down at her from behind the mask.
Jason's fingers connect.  Her throat collapses.  BLOOD BU
Cort is still rockin' out behind the wheel.  He checks hi rear-view mirror again.
Hey, what are you doing?  Taking a dump?... How about if I come back and snatch a peek.  Or vice versa.
As he cackles with amusement, JASON THROWS OPEN THE DOOR. Cort doesn't hear it.  Menacingly, JASON STALKS HIM.
His hand pulls out the long, jagged survival knife.  He h it poised and ready.
Slowly, the infamous slasher closes in on Cort.
Cort drives, oblivious to the grim reaper standing right behind him.
A new SONG plays on the radio.  Cort beams, recognizing i a favorite of his.  He turns it UP.
Alright!  Yo, Jill!  Listen to this!
He looks up into the rear-view mirror.

head_text.subj: JASON'S HOCKEY-MASKED FACE GLARES AT HIM.
JASON'S HAND GRABS HIM BY THE HAIR.
BACK OF CORT'S HEAD AS THE JAGGED KNIFE PLUNGES

text: HIS EAR.  Suddenly, all SOUND CUTS OUT.
We watch in EERIE SILENCE as Jason lets go of Cort's knif head.  The lifeless body flops over the wheel.  Immediate the RV veers off to the left.
SOUND RESUMES as the runaway mobile home drives off the r with a horrible CRASH, it falls over on its left side.
Slowly the fog swirls around the motionless vehicle.  We wait, SUDDENLY, THE DOOR BURSTS UP AND OUT.  Jason climbs of the wreckage.
Surrounded by an evil fog, Jason stands atop the fallen m beast like a conquering warrior.
(very perturbed) What makes you so high and mighty?... You keep forgetting, little Megan, I'm the parent...
Megan is slouched in a chair and pouting.
(interrupting mockingly) ...And you're the child...
She sits up in hot-blooded frustration.
When are you going to stop treating me like one!
When you stop acting like one... Tommy Jarvis is a very sick boy. And you...
How do you know?  Did you take his temperature?
(pointing at her) You watch that smart-mouthing, young lady.
She crosses her eyes in a comic attempt to watch her mout
Kinda hard to see it from this angle?  Got a mirror?
Megan enjoys pushing her temperamental father to the limi He stomps around like Ralph Kramden.
(coolly) Now tell me, "If your mother was alive, you wouldn't..."
The poor sheriff finally blows sky-high.  He throws open door.
That's it!  Out!  I don't need this tonight.  Out, Megan!
The sheriff gets a CALL over the SHORT-WAVE.  Unintimidat by his bellowing, Megan calmly answers it.
Sheriff's office... (listens) ...Can you hold on?  He's in the can draining his lizard.
slams the door and roars toward his precocious daughter.
(sweetly into phone) ...Oh, here he comes now... (to sheriff) ...Daddy, it's Rick.
The growling sheriff practically rips the receiver out of snickering Megan's hand.
(barking) What?!...What kinda problem?!
Deputy Colone stands outside his squad car.  Talking into mike, he stares fearfully at the VW Bug and Lizbeth's floating corpse in the background.
You better get down here.  I found what's left of the counselors. Looks like someone did them in using Jason's old M.O.
(rubbing his face) I knew I should've done something about that sonofa... Where are you?... (listens) ...Right.  I'm on my way.
Megan grows concerned as her father gathers his things wi a deadly urgency.
What it is?
(trying to control his emotions) Not what...who.  Seems your boyfriend wants people to believe Jason has returned.
(catching him) I thought Jason was only a legend?
He is.  Only Tommy wants to prove the legend is true... (ordering her) ...You stay put.  And I'm not kidding.
Grabbing his rifle, the sheriff rushes out.
She stares, wondering what the hell is going on.
WE TRACK with Jason's filthy boots.  He's walking at a fa clip toward his destination.
TRACK with Jason's hand holding the razor-sharp machete.
DOLLY BACK as Jason's maleficent eyes stare with pure hat He keeps coming right at us.

Megan sits alone at the desk...waiting.  A large window i right behind her.  Bored, she puts her feet on the edge o the desk.  She then leans back toward the window, seeing far back the chair will go and still stay balanced.

head_text.subj: CIRCLE AND PRESS IN SLOWLY ON MEGAN

text: Tension builds as we move closer to the balancing girl an the window behind her.  We stop and wait.  SUDDENLY THE P RINGS LOUDLY.  It startles Megan, who screams as she pratfalls backwards.
Laughing at herself, she gets up and answers the phone.
Sheriff's office... (listens) ...No, I'm sorry, he's not in at the moment.  Can I take a message?
As she listens, Megan immediately straightens up.
...Oh, hi.  I'm Megan, his daughter.  Remember, I met you this morning...
Tommy is in a badly sabotaged old phone booth next to a closed gas station.  He is illuminated by the LIGHTS of h pickup.
(preoccupied) Yeah, hi.  Listen, I've got to talk to your dad.  About Jason. I've got a plan.  I need to buy some things first but mainly need help to...
Tommy, my father is out looking for you right now.  Something happened tonight and he's sure you're responsible.  If he finds you, he'll...

(interrupting) I already have a very good idea what could've happened... (frustrated) ...Megan, Jason is out there.  He has to be stopped.  I'm positive he's heading back to the lake area.  He'll keep killing until...
I'll pick you up.  Where are you?
(shocked) What?
(determined) It's the only way.  My father will nail you in your car in a second... (demanding) ...Where are you?
Tommy looks around for something identifiable.
Uh...Howie's Service Station and Feed Bag Stop.  I think it's...
(on phone) I know where it is.  See you within a half-hour.
Hearing her HANG-UP, Tommy does the same and exits the bo
He looks around, shivers and zips up his jacket.  He's worried about involving Megan in this.  He's worried for himself.
Out of the foggy shadows, an evil spectre emerges into th moonlight...JASON.  He stares.
The renovated campsite looks quite peaceful and calm befo the...
He cocks his head, not quite sure why it looks so differe But it feels like home.  With machete in hand, he proceed into the camp ground.

A grossly bloody sheet.  It covers a corpse that is lifte into an ambulance. As we PULL BACK, Sheriff Garris and TWO OTHER OFFICERS wh in disgust.  The sheriff suddenly turns and heads for the patrol cars.  Officers PAPPAS and THORNTON follow behind.
(controlling his rage) I want all officers, all units and stations within a fifty-mile radius alerted about this wacko kid.
Yes, sir.
You have his vehicle description. I want roadblocks on...
(yelling from distance) Sheriff!  Get over here!!
He takes off into the woods toward his deputy's voice.
We MOVE rapidly through the maze of trees and brush.
He heads towards us, searching for the deputy.
Sheriff, over here!
We TURN and HEAD FOR Deputy Colone waving a flashlight at
Running up to his ashen-faced deputy, Sheriff Garris look down at what Rick holds out.
A pair of blood-splattered glasses.  We recognize them as once belonging to Roy, the last remaining survival hunter
The sheriff looks at him.
Is that all you found?
I wish it was.
He shines his flashlight at the ground.
is illuminated before us.  It wears an Army fatigue sleev We FOLLOW the light over a couple of yards to a HACKED-OF LEG, also in fatigues.
Both keep staring stoically down at the body parts.
Better get out the Hefty Bags... Looks like our boy desperately wants us to believe his story.
He sure chose the right day to pull this shit.
Whaddya mean?
(cryptically) Happy Friday the 13th.
The sheriff slowly looks over at him in utter disbelief.
WHACK!  The machete blade cuts the phone cord in half.
He stares at his handiwork, then heads towards the lit an open window.
Paula has fallen asleep on her bed.  The phone is right n to her.
is wearing headphones, listening to her Walkman.  She sit her bed, ogling through the pages of a "PLAYGIRL" magazin
The magazine is filled with beefcake-posing guys.  She is practically drooling on the pages.  In the background, a figure quickly passes by the open window.
The movement catches her eye.  She cranes her head to loo
Taking off the ROCK 'N' ROLL BLARING headphones, Sissy sh off her Walkman.  She walks over to the window and looks
Sissy, framed by the open window, surveys the area.
All is still and motionless in the campgrounds.
A bit perplexed.  She knows she saw something.  She start turn away, when the SOUND of LEAVES CRUNCHING underfoot i HEARD.  She sticks her head out the window.  She tries to sound authoritative.
All right, who's out there?
stirs and awakens halfway.
(sleepily) What's goin' on?
(a bit nervous) I think somebody's messin' around out there.
Paula smirks, rolls over, and closes her eyes.
It's gotta be Cort.  He loves to scare people... (falling asleep) ...Teach him a lesson.
She HEARS FOOTSTEPS right below the window.  She thinks, breaks into an impish grin, seeing something.  Sissy quie tiptoes over to the table and picks up her half-consumed of "Cherry Coke."
Sissy, trying not to laugh, sneaks back to the window.  S crouches down, then extends the can outside.
Her hands turn it over and sticky "Cherry Coke" pours dow her victim.  We HEAR IT HITTING SOMEONE.
Quickly she withdraws the can and jumps back from the win Expecting a response, she is surprised not to get one. Stifling a laugh, she creeps back toward the window.
Tension mounts as she reaches the frame and tentatively p over it.  SHOCKINGLY, JASON SPRINGS UP AND GRABS HER.
Bottom half of Sissy's body is WHIPPED VIOLENTLY OUT THRO THE WINDOW.
just as Sissy's legs fly out through the window.
(groggy) Hey, you guys.  Try got to wake the kids.
Paula listens.  She HEARS a STRUGGLE, a WHOOSH, a THUMP, SILENCE.  She snickers once again, then falls back into dreamland.
Megan's orange Camaro SCREECHES UP.  We FOLLOW as she jum out and is met by Tommy.
(adamantly) I'm gonna borrow your car.  You can't do this with me.  It's much too dangerous.
She looks past him at his pickup.
And you can't leave that truck out in plain sight.  Talk about dangerous.
Tommy turns around to look.
What?
Hide it behind the gas station. Then we can get the hell out of here.
He turns back to her.
(irritated) Look, this isn't a game.  You're not going with me.  I'm already responsible for causing the death of...
Megan cuts him off.
(quickly) Didn't you say you needed some supplies to do this?
Uh...yes.  But...
(firmly) Then let's get goin'.  We can argue on the way.  You tell me what you need... (with a sly smile) ...I'll make sure you get in.
She heads toward her LOUDLY PURRING Camaro.
...And nobody drives this baby but me... (pointing) ...Now get that pickup hid and let's boog.
There isn't much he can say.  With an exasperated sigh, h runs to move his truck.
SLOWLY we TRACK along a row of sleeping children.  Each h her own unique position of slumber.  We PULL BACK to reve her large windows just above them beaming in moonlight.

head_text.subj: JASON'S SILHOUETTE CARRYING SISSY'S HEADLESS CORPSE PASSE

text: We FOLLOW Jason's evil shadow as it crosses more sleeping kids.  When it falls across little Nancy, her half-open e flash open!  She sits up in wide-eyed fear as we rapidly PRESS IN on her.
Megan's hot Camaro jets down the road, kickin' up dust.
Tommy shoots Megan a look.
(dryly) Can this tub go any faster?
She returns a flirtatious grin.
(self-assured) You got it.  Just keep an eye out for roadblocks.
(looking ahead; deadpan) Okay.  There's one.
As they round the bend, two police cars with lights a- flashin' are blocking the road.
Megan's car SKIDS to a stop.
Tommy looks at the temperature Megan for a plan.  She delivers.  Grabbing his head, she pulls it down onto her
(forcefully) Get down.
He stares bug-eyed as he confronts her tight-jeaned crotc
She slams it into reverse.
The orange bomber ROARS backwards down the road.
spring into action and give chase.
Pappas, the very good-looking one of the two officers see earlier, calls it in!
(into mike) Unit 45, Officer Pappas to Sheriff Garris.  Do you copy?
The distressed sheriff answers the call.
(into mike) Yeah, I'm here.  What?
(over radio) Got a different vehicle that just turned tail seeing us.  Saw somebody duck down.
Got a description or plates?
The whole enchilada.  It's an '82 orange Camaro, license...
Megan's car back quickly into a turnoff, then PEELS OUT f steam ahead!
Officer Pappas is just finishing the vehicle's descriptio when the sheriff explodes:
(over radio) Son of a shittin' bitch!  That's my daughter's car!!
(nervous) How should we proceed, sir?
(beside himself emotionally) With extreme car, for God's sake. If that kid is with her, there's every good chance he'll do something crazy.

head_text.subj: TOMMY'S FACE STILL ON HER LAP

text: (to Megan) Please don't do anything crazy.
She drives like a hellcat trying to lose the pursuing cop
I know what I'm doing.  I got your supplies for ya, didn't I?... Now if I can get to Cunningham Road, I can lose them... (Tommy starts to sit up) ...Just stay where you are.
He puts his head back down and stares at the view.
(deadpan) Whatever you say.
Megan's car ROARS by, immediately followed by the two pol cars.
Headlights illuminate the windy path we TRAVEL.  Enormous trees stand dangerously close to the curved road.
Our strong-willed heroine is determined to reach her destination.
The Camaro fires past us.  One cop car, then the other, follow suit.  All three vehicles' tires SQUEAL on the hazardous curves.
Megan's wild driving causes his head to roll around in he lap.  He tries to be discreet about where it keeps landin
That's what I want.
Tommy registers surprise.
What she sees ahead has her beaming with confidence.
Two signposts are seen.  One reads "Cunningham Road," the other "Camp Forest Green" with an arrow pointing right.
This is gonna be a hairy turn. Grab ahold of something.
He looks up at her with a look of "you gotta be kidding."
Her car SCREAMS around the turn onto Cunningham Road.

head_text.subj: SHOCKINGLY, HER FATHER AND HIS CAR ARE WAITING IN THE DAR

text: FOR THEM.  The deputy and his car are right behind the sheriff.  Both have their rifles aimed and ready.
Megan's car barely has enough room to brake.  The Camaro fishtails to a stop.  The sheriff remains stock-still, no flinching at all.
With a deadly cool, her orders his daughter:
Megan, step out of the car!
She stares in horror at her father.  She's never seen him point a gun at her.  But then again she's never pulled a stunt like this.  Megan then looks down at her feet.
He is sprawled across the floorboard, his face between Megan's feet.  He stares at her in utter dread.
It's all over.
(shaking his head) It's just beginning.
We HEAD across the campgrounds toward the counselors' cab Climbing the steps, we slowly open the door.
Paula is sound asleep.  The SOUND of the DOOR OPENING cau her to stir.
We CONTINUE through the door into the cabin.  Looking aro we spot the sleeping counselor.  We HEAD for her.
Tension builds as we stare at the restless girl.  Sensing someone over her, Paula opens her eyes.  She gasps!
A bloody machete is held out before us.
Little Nancy stands over Paula, holding the machete.
I can't sleep, Paula.  I'm scared. I saw someone at the window and...
Paula sits up quickly and grabs the disgusting machete.
(interrupting) Where'd you get this?
(pointing) I found it outside.
Paula doesn't know what to think.  Looking around the cab and not seeing anyone, she draws some rapid conclusions.
(trying to sound comforting) You know what?  Sissy and Cort are playing jokes.  You know, trying to scare each other.
(innocently) Why?
Well, grown-ups think it's funny to be scared.
(confused) Are they grown-ups?
That's debatable.
(more confused) Huh?
Paula shakes her head, puts the machete down on the floor and stands up.
Never mind... (looks at watch) ...Is it that lake already?
She grabs the phone and starts to dial.
I can't believe no one called back.  I better...
Who ya calling?
realizes the child doesn't need to hear this conversation She hangs up.
Why don't we first try and find Sissy and Cort, then you can go to sleep.
She takes Nancy's hand and they head for the door.
(worried) But what if they try and scare us?
(playfully) We'll scare 'em right back.
Nancy giggles with delight.  They exit the cabin door.
Paula leads Nancy down the steps.  She makes a game out o quietly sneaking around, looking for the missing counselo For the child, this is fun.

head_text.subj: WITHOUT WARNING, JASON'S MASKED FACE IS BEFORE US. A STI

text: accompanies this SHOCK CUT.
In the dark shadows, Jason watches the two giggling girls He waits for his moment.  For Jason, this is fun.
(adamantly) ...And I said, shut up!
(just as adamant) All he's asking is for you to check it out.
(pleading) You got me where you want me. There's no reason not...

head_text.subj: TIGHTEN AS SHERIFF STOMPS TOWARD HIM

text: (restraining his rage) If I had you where I really wanted you, they'd be pumping your ass full of formaldehyde.
Can't you at least call the camp and make sure everything's all right?
(snapping at her) We have!  Trying to track you down.  The phone there is disconnected.
Doesn't that tell you something?!
Yeah...They should've paid their bill.
In the background we HEAR a CALL coming in on the radio. Deputy Colone is HEARD answering it.  The sheriff points Tommy.
(icy hatred) You just sit tight, Jason.  Once the authorities from Carpenter get here, you'll...
(interrupting; urgent) Sheriff, you better take this.
We TRACK with the sheriff over to the deputy on the radio headset.
(taking the call) Sheriff Garris... (as he listens, he reacts to the horrible news) ...Approximately what time? (he glares in Tommy's direction) ...I'll be right there.
We FOLLOW the sheriff as he grabs his coat and hat to lea Megan runs up to him.
What?...What happened?!
Her father looks past her to his deputy.
(coldly) Rick.  Keep and eye on our wacko kid.  I'll be back as soon as I can.
(insistent) Daddy, what is going on?
(to Rick) And make sure my daughter stays put... (looking at Megan) ...She's grounded.
Megan steps in his path as he turns to go.  She pushes against his chest as hard as she can.
(exploding) Tell me!!
The sheriff immediately raises his hand to strike her.  T quickly controlling himself, he grabs her by the shoulder
(clenching teeth) They just found your friend Cort and some girl.  She was brutally strangled, and Cort...he had a knife rammed through his skull.
Megan shakes her head in disbelief.
No.  No, it's not...
Yes, Megan.  Tommy Jarvis is a killer.  A very deranged boy who wants you to believe that...
Jason did do it.  I swear! Sheriff, when were they murdered?
He disregards Tommy's question and stares at his daughter with sincere concern.
For God's sake, stat away from him.  Please, Meggie.
As he starts again to leave, Megan, still in shock from t news, grabs her father's arm.
(intensely) Dad...What time were they murdered?
The sheriff hesitates, not wanting to answer.  Somehow it blurts out:
They think somewhere around 8:30 or 9:00.
steps right up to her father.
I was with Tommy all that time.
This obviously hits him on more than one level.  He masks reaction, turns, and heads for the door.
Rick, I'll call you when I get there.
He exits and slams the door.
with sorrowful eyes, looks back at Tommy.
slams both fists against the bars.
Damn.
Paula and Nancy are tiptoeing, trying not to awaken the o children.  Reaching little Nancy's bed, Paula tucks her i snugly.  She crouches next to the child.
(whispering) I'm sure Cort and Sissy are back in their cabins.  So you just go back to sleep and don't worry.
But what I get scared again?
(whispering) Shhh...You know what I used to do when I was a little girl when I got scared?
Nancy shakes her head timidly.
(whispering) I would close my eyes and say a little prayer.  And pretty soon, you know what?  Everything scary went away... (reassuringly) ...It worked for me.  I'll bet it'll work for you too.
She kisses the child's forehead.
(lovingly) Good night.  See ya in the morning.
As she stands up, we see JASON GLARING AT THEM THROUGH TH WINDOW.  Paula smiles tenderly at Nancy.
Nancy smiles back at her, rolls over, and closes her eyes
She begins to quietly head for the door.  JASON FOLLOWS R ALONG OUTSIDE FROM WINDOW TO WINDOW.
Paula exits the dormitory door as silently as possible. looks around the area, still very concerned about her companions.
A gently breeze is blowing away the evening fog.  The tre and brushes seem to shiver nervously.
as she slowly descends the steps.  Somehow she can sense deadly face.  Paula looks around again, then hurries towa her cabin.
Paula races across the camp to the counselor's cabin.
She rushes up the cabin steps and finds the door closed. seems relieved.
Sissy?
As Paula enters, she is disappointed to find it empty.
She hurries to the phone and starts dialing.  For the fir time, she realizes the phone is dead.  Her frustration tu to alarm when she notices something at her feet.

head_text.subj: THE MACHETE SHE LEFT ON THE FLOOR IS GONE. BLOODY STAINS
THE FLOOR MARK WHERE IT HAD LAIN.

text: hears a NOISE and turns to look.
It moves a bit.  Was it the wind or is someone behind it?

Not sure if it's a joke or her imagination, Paula slowly heads towards it.  Tension mounts.  Just as she reaches i she slowly extends her hand to grab the knob.  SUDDENLY, WIND BLOWS IT TOWARD HER.  She backs up.  It slams shut. one, of course, is there.  She giggles at herself and reo the door.  JASON IS RIGHT THERE IN THE DOORWAY.

head_text.subj: TIGHT ON JASON'S MACHETE AS IT ADVANCES

text: A few yards from the cabin, we watch as Jason quickly lun at Paula and SLAMS the door, MUFFLING her SCREAM.
Deputy Colone is hunched over his desk, doing what he hat most...filling out reports.  He glances up at Tommy, then over at Megan.  Satisfied, he returns to his shitwork.
Seated across the room, she appears to be idly sketching something on a large pad.
sits on his jail cot, head in hands, hopeless.
looks up at the deputy, then over at Tommy.
He glances up at her.
She holds up the sketch pad for him to read.  As she does his eyes widen, amazed at what she's written.  He mouths you sure?" as she lowers the pad.
She nods a strong affirmative.
Tommy gets up off his cot and stretches nonchalantly.  He eyes the deputy, then Megan.  She flips a page over, and starts to really sketch.
So what are ya drawin'?
What's it to ya?
looks up, irritated by the noise.
Hey, pipe down, Jarvis.
grabs the cell bars.
I was just curious about what she was drawin'.
holds it up for Tommy to see.
(sarcastic) There...Ya happy?
No.
Why?
'Cause it stinks.
Megan throws the sketch pad at him.  It bounces off the b
He reaches down, grabs it, and pulls it into his cell.
stands up defiantly.
Okay, give it back.
(slyly) Come and get it.
This is really getting him pissed.  He gets up.
Bastard...Megan, I'll get in.
is already in front of the wall.  She reaches through the bars for the pad.
Give it to me, punk.
Suddenly he grabs her arm, pulls her to the bars, and sta kissing her passionately.  The more she struggles, the tighter he envelopes her.
He races across the room.  Awkwardly, he grapples to sepa them.
As they battle, Megan's hand secretly reaches down and pu the gun from the deputy's holster.
Megan allows herself to be torn from Tommy's embrace.  Th angry deputy reaches at Tommy, who backs away into the ce
You stinkin' maggot, I oughta...!
(demanding) Let him out of there.
As he turns to face Megan, a red laser dot appears on the of his nose.
Megan points the laser-scoped revolver right at us.  She definitely means business.
He chuckles in disbelief.
Come on, Megan, don't clown around.
holds the gun dead-steady.
I ain't the one with the funny red nose...Open the cell and exchange places...with him... (she cocks the trigger) ...Now.
The boy moves up behind him and reinforces the seriousnes the situation.
(enjoying this) Better do as she says, 'cause ...wherever the red dot goes, a bullet is sure to follow.
The deputy reluctantly removes his keys and turns toward Tommy.
(furiously) You brainwashed her, you sonofabitch?
breaks into a cocky smile, and answers for him.
Yeah, something like that.
Tommy and Megan fly out the door and race toward the Cama
Got the keys?
reaches under the car and quickly withdraws a tiny box.
No, he took 'em...But I got my Hide-a-Key.
rushes up and grabs it from her.
Sorry, Megan.  Not this time.
(pissed) Wait a minute. I just...
(determined) I thank you for getting me out. But I gotta finish what I started.
stares defiantly at him as she opens the driver's door an gets in.  She suddenly slides over to the passenger's sea
Well, come on, hot lips, let's go. You drive, I'll navigate.
Tommy throws up his hands, then climbs in.  The car start and ROARS down the street.
JASON PATROLS THE CHILDREN'S CABIN.  Slowly and menacingl he walks by the sleeping youngsters.
Slumbering soundly, they have no awareness of the monster the edge of their beds.
reaches the end of the dormitory.  With his back to us, h stops, senses something, and whips around.
He glares at someone with evil intent.
The terrified child's eyes peek from under the sheet.  Sh ain't dreaming.  This monster is real.
Jason stands and stares at Nancy at the other end of the cabin.  He then stalks her.

head_text.subj: SHERIFF GARRIS' CAR PULLS ONTO THE CAMPSITE

text: Another patrol car, with Officer Pappas and Thornton, pul up behind it.  The wind is getting stronger as it whips through the trees.
The child is frozen in pure terror.  She can't even cry o
Slowly, Jason's masked face descends toward us.
The child squeezes her eyes shut and begins to pray, very quickly:
(whimpering) Now I lay me down to sleep, I pray the Lord my soul to keep...
(voice quavering) ...If I should die before I wake, I pray the Lord my soul to take. Now I lay me... etc.
Jason HEARS the CAR DOOR SLAM outside.  His face turns to the noise.  He immediately heads for it.
With her eyes still tightly shut, she continues to pray, unaware that her monster has gone.
Sheriff Garris surveys the campgrounds suspiciously.  The officers approach him.
So what's the story here?
Why don't you boys nose around. I gotta go break the news to Megan's friends about what's happened.  Holler if you see anything.
Like what?
heads for the lit counselor's cabin.
Anything that don't belong.  And don't wake the kids.
The two officers take out their flashlights.  They spread and scan the area.  The RAGING wind causes everything to WHISTLE and move.
KNOCKING is HEARD on it.
Girls?  It's Sheriff Garris.
Slowly he opens the door and sticks his head in.
He is horrified!
The entire room is SPLATTERED WITH BLOOD.  It drips from ceiling and streaks down the walls.
Quickly, he bolts out of the room.
The sheriff races down the steps and heads for the childr dormitories.
Officer Thornton's flashlight scans the two boats along t small dock.  Nothing unusual here.
Although we can't see anyone in the WIND-RUSTLED bushes, sense Jason is watching the lone cop.
His hand withdraws a long, razor-sharp devil dart.
With his back to us, the unsuspecting cop concludes his search of the landing and turns around.  His flashlight n focuses on the woods before him.
We FOLLOW the flashlight beam as it surveys the windswept area.  JASON IS ILLUMINATED!  He raises up the sinister d
Recognizing a weapon in this prowler's hand, he goes for revolver.
With supernatural strength, he throws the deadly projecti at us.
Before he can pull his gun, THE DEVIL IMPALES ITSELF DEEP INTO HIS FOREHEAD.  The force of it sends him reeling bac
Officer Thornton's body falls into it.  His lifeless eyes stare up at the sky.  The dart extends from his third eye
A row of sleeping boys stacking Z's in their cots.
Standing in the doorway, the sheriff quietly closes the d
The panicked sheriff now rushes across to the girls' dorm
As silently as possible, he opens the door and peeks it. carefully surveys all the slumbering occupants.  The sher suddenly registers alarm.
All the girls are nestled contentedly in their beds...exc one.  The covers have been kicked off and her pillow lies the floor.  Little Nancy is missing.
The orange speed-demon Camaro rockets past us.
Megan, sitting shotgun, stares open-mouthed at Tommy.
(sarcastically) Let me know when you're about to blast into hyperspace.  I'll fasten my seat belt.
drives like a man possessed.
I got a bad feeling we're already too late.
Megan glances back at the large sack in the rear seat.  S reaches over and looks in at his supplies doubtfully.
Are you sure this is gonna work? I mean, why didn't we bring that gun and just blast him away?
It probably wouldn't have any effect on him.  The only sure way to stop Jason is to return him to his original resting place, where he drowned in 1957.
Lake Forest Green?
(nods, then corrects her) Crystal Lake...where the nightmare began.
The infamous lake is churning in the moonlight.  RACK FOC as Officer Pappas steps before us.  It's apparent that he getting tired of searching for God-knows-what.
His flashlight scans the windblown, vibrating bushes. Suddenly, FOOTSTEPS are HEARD on the other side of the bu
He stops abruptly and strains to listen.  Tentatively, he creeps toward the bushes.
We HEAD toward whatever is hiding behind the trembling shrubbery.
Reaching the brushes, he calls out:
Alright, come out of there!
No reply.
He draws his revolver and aims it.  He knows someone's th
I'm askin' you one more time ...come out of there!
Still no response.
With his gun held before him, the nervous officer goes fo closer look.
Tension builds as he comes closer.
He is almost to the bushes.  WITHOUT WARNING, SOMEONE DIV BEFORE US AND ATTACKS HIS LEG.  He gasps aloud.
The frightened child holds on to Pappas for dear life.  H catches his breath, then crouches down next to her.
(kindly) Hey, hey, what are you doing running around out here?  Now you get back to bed.
She squeezes his leg even tighter.
(terrified) No.  There's a scary man.
The good-looking officer smiles with amusement.
What scary man?

head_text.subj: JASON EXPLODES OUT OF THE BUSHES.
NANCY RUNS SHRIEKING TOWARD THE CAMP.
OFFICER PAPPAS OPENS FIRE ON JASON.
THE BULLETS PENETRATE HIS CHEST, BUT HE KEEPS COMING.

text: Suddenly Jason is before him.  His powerful hand reaches and grabs the officer's SCREAMING face.

head_text.subj: JASON'S FINGERS DIG IN TO THE COP'S SKIN. HE YANKS DOWN,
LITERALLY RIPPING THE SKIN OFF HIS SKULL.
A BLOODY GRINNING SKULL STARES AT US FOR A MOMENT, THEN D

text: is thrown open.  The sheriff reaches in and quickly pulls his shotgun.
Leaving the door open, he sprints across the camp towards gunshots.
As he rounds the corner of a cabin, Nancy comes SCREECHIN toward him.  He catches the child and attempts to comfort
Hold on.  Take it easy.  I got you.  Everything is fine.
As he hugs her, he looks up at the boys' dormitory cabin.
All the children are pressed against the windows, staring down terrified.
Quickly, the sheriff picks Nancy up and heads for the cab
Sheriff Garris bursts into the cabin.  All the girls have gathered in the boys' cabin for safety.  He puts little N down and addresses the petrified youngsters.
Kids, listen to me very carefully. I want everyone to lie down on the floor and stay there.  Do not get up until I come back.  Now hurry.
Some cover their heads, others crawl under the cots.
The sheriff runs out of the children's cabin, securing th door behind him.

head_text.subj: TIGHT ON SHOTGUN IN HIS HANDS

text: He pumps the weapon as he walks.
With stern vigilance, he storms toward his objective.
arrives in the area behind the cabins near the lake.  The is no one to be found.  The savage wind whips the trees a bushes, causing the sheriff to twitch at every movement.
Slowly, he turns and heads into the shadowed area between cabins.
With the shotgun held before him, he walks tensely throug this dark passage.
The sheriff's eyes dart nervously, straining to see in th near blackness.  Suddenly, he trips and falls from view.
Rapidly, we TILT DOWN as he slams down on Officer Pappas' corpse.

head_text.subj: THE SHERIFF'S FACE LANDS PRESSED AGAINST THE GROTESQUE BL

text: SKULL.  Horribly repulsed, he scrambles to his feet.
stands up, turns, and JASON IS WAITING RIGHT THERE.
Quickly, he backs away from this masked spectre of evil. Then they both stands motionless for a long time, sizing other up.
He decides to make the first move.  He lunges forward.
Instantly, he raises the shotgun and BLASTS Jason with bo barrels!
A hole is ripped out of Jason's side!

head_text.subj: IT DOESN'T FAZE HIM AT ALL. HE KEEPS COMING.

text: Shocked beyond belief, the sheriff drops the rifle and pu out his .357.  Backing up, he empties the chamber into th stalking ghoul.
As he advances on the firing sheriff, we see THE BULLETS EXITING FROM JASON'S BACK.
All this is only making him madder.
His gun CLICKING empty, he has but one option left.  He t it.  The sheriff turns and runs like hell toward the wood JASON IS RIGHT BEHIND.
Megan's Camaro roars into the campsite next to the police cars.  Megan jumps out and looks around for her father. Tommy grabs the heavy sack from the back seat.
(excited; pointing at cars) They did show up.  Isn't that great?
(worried) I hope so.
sees the lights on in the counselors' cabin.  She rushes toward it.
Megan, wait!
Megan dashes up the steps and throws the door open.  She SCREAMS in horror at the blood-spattered room.  She turns runs toward the dormitories.
Dad!...Daddy!!
lugging the heavy sack, chases after her.
No, Megan!
Through the violently windblown forest dashes our "former macho" sheriff.  Primal instincts tell him only one thing save your own ass.  He runs for his life.
continues his pursuit of the lawman.
Megan BURSTS in through the door!  All the kids SCREAM. quickly scans the room.
Petrified little faces stare up at her from the floor.
She hurries into the cabin.
It's okay.  It's me--Megan.  Don't be afraid.

head_text.subj: NANCY AND A COUPLE OTHER KIDS

text: run over and hug her for security.
(trying to sound calm) It's all right.  Shhh-hh.
Tommy looks in and is relieved to see they're all right. quickly turns and runs back down the steps.
Tommy races from the campsite toward the dock, lugging th heavy satchel.
Reaching the landing, he starts to board one of the two b
He recoils in horror.
The murdered cop, Officer Thornton, lies in the rowboat. dead eyes glare right at us.  Blood flows from the impale dart in his forehead.
He immediately goes for another boat.
Unfortunately, this one is older and more rickety, eviden when Tommy steps into it and it SQUEAKS and MOANS.
Opening it up, Tommy pulls out a long and very heavy chai He then withdraws some huge padlocks.
With intense urgency, he looks along the lake shore for something.
Suddenly, they stop, turn, and retrace their steps.
Seems he has lost his prey.  Carefully, he searches the RUSTLING bushes for the hiding sheriff.
Buried deep in the thick bushes, the winded sheriff holds breath as Jason passes.
Megan has done her best to assure the children that they safe.  She stands up.
Now I gotta find my daddy, the sheriff, so we can all go home. Okay?
The kids nod.
heads for the door.  She turns to them.
So you stay here and we'll be back to get you.  Everyone lie back down and don't worry.
The 12-year-old youngsters seen earlier.  Billy turns to sarcastic friend Tyen.
(scared) What do you think?
I think we're dead meat.
Tommy struggles to roll a large, heavy rock toward the bo In the background, Megan is running around the campsite CALLING OUT for her father.
Already fearing the worst, he yells to Megan:
Megan!  Use your dad's car radio and call for assistance...and an ambulance!
She stares at Tommy, petrified at what that means.  She t runs toward the sheriff's car.
As Megan throws the car door open, SISSY'S HEAD ROLLS OUT LANDS AT HER FEET.
She goes berserk with horror.
(screaming) Oh, God!  Oh my God!
Megan looks around, terrified that this same fate has befallen her father.  She SCREAMS OUT even LOUDER:
Dad!  Answer me!  Daddy, where are you!  Help us!
Lying on the floor, Tyen looks at Billy with a what-did-I tell-ya' attitude.
(scared) Real dead meat.
He looks up, HEARING his daughter's distant CRY.  What ca do?
He stops his search.  He HEARS Megan as well.  JASON HEAD THE DIRECTION OF MEGAN'S VOICE.
The sheriff peeks out of his hiding place.  Our killer st by without seeing him.  Jason is hell-bent for Megan.
Seeing Jason heading towards his daughter, his protective fatherly instincts cause him to take action without thoug He leaps out at Jason!
No!  Not her!
With almost superhuman strength, the sheriff attacks Jaso and starts pounding him into the ground.
So aggressive and relentless is the pummeling, for a mome you think he might kill the monster.  But only for a mome
Only disoriented and not at all hurt, Jason rolls over un the sheriff.  He grasps the sheriff's arm, stopping the assault.

head_text.subj: JASON SHOCKINGLY TEARS THE SHERIFF'S ARMS OUT OF THEIR

text: SOCKETS.  He throws them aside.

head_text.subj: JASON GRIPS THE SHRIEKING LAWMAN'S HEAD. HE PUSHES IT BA
CAUSING THE SHERIFF'S BODY TO BEND ALL THE WAY BACKWARDS.

text: As he is forced back toward his feet, a horrid CRACK is HEARD.  HIS SPINE HAS BEEN SNAPPED IN HALF.  His body collapses backwards.
Enraged, Jason throws the rag doll-like body of the sheri aside as he rises.  Megan's VOICE is HEARD again, calling the father.  JASON HEADS FOR HER.
Megan is struggling to help Tommy get the huge rock into boat.  Her eyes are watering from fear.
You gotta help me look for him...We need him to help us.
The chains are arranged to go around the rock.  Tommy tri to brace himself as they lower the boulder down.  A CRACK HEARD as the huge stone lands in the old wooden boat.
(exhausted) Whew...Okay, hand me those padlocks.
(near hysteria) Did you hear me?!
(impatiently) Yes.  And I said, hand me those padlocks.
She grabs the locks and gives them to him angrily.
You're gonna be sorry.
starts padlocking the chains tightly around the rock.
I hope not.

head_text.subj: JASON STOMPS THROUGH THE WINDY FOREST.

text: Tommy straightens out the rest of the heavy chain.  He fashions a noose.
paces the dock in nervous fear.  She doesn't know what to
Tommy unties the boat and pushes off the dock into the churning water.
Megan!  Get back into the cabin with the kids.
keeps pacing and looking around nervously.
Megan, please!
Suddenly it dawns on her that he's actually leaving her a out here.  She panics.
No.  Don't leave.
He starts rowing out into the lake.
(adamant) Megan, get in there with them before it's too late.
It's too late...JASON EXPLODES THROUGH THE DOOR, KNOCKING OFF ITS HINGES.
run SCREAMING to the back of the cabin.
She races from the landing toward the cabin.
Tommy watches, helpless.  He stands up.
